graph.original_query: Conduct comprehensive market research on electric vehicle trends and create a detailed analysis report with visualizations

ev_market_data.text: [{'url': 'https://ourworldindata.org/electric-car-sales', 'content': 'Tracking global data on electric vehicles - Our World in Data Our World in Data Browse by topic Data Insights Resources About Subscribe Donate Gdoc / Admin Home Energy Tracking global data on electric vehicles Explore data on electric car sales and stocks worldwide. By: Hannah Ritchie First published in February 2024. Last updated in May 2025. Cite this article Reuse our work freely Electric vehicles are an essential solution to decarbonizing transport. Electric cars tend to have a lower carbon footprint than petrol or diesel cars over their lifetimes. While more carbon is emitted in the manufacturing stage, this carbon debt tends to pay off quickly once theyre on the road. 1 The carbon savings are higher in countries with a cleaner electricity mix , and these savings will also increase as countries continue to decarbonize their electricity grids. How quickly are countries moving to electrified transport? Which countries are leading the way? In this article, we look at data from across the world on electric vehicle (EV) sales and the stock on the road. This data comes from the International Energy Agency . It publishes its Global EV Outlook every year. We will update this data every time a new release is published. 2 Sales of new cars What share of new cars are electric? Sales of electric cars started from a low base but are growing quickly in many markets. Globally, over 1-in-5 (22%) of new cars sold were electric in 2024. This share was 92% in Norway, and in China, it was almost 50%. In the chart below, you can explore these trends across the world. Here, electric cars include fully battery-electric vehicles and plug-in hybrids . Fully-electric cars vs. plug-in hybrids Electric cars include battery-electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles. The difference is that fully battery-electric cars do not have an internal combustion engine. In contrast, plug-in hybrids have a rechargeable battery and electric motor, and an internal combustion engine that runs on gasoline. That means a plug-in hybrid could be driven as a standard petrol car if the owner did not charge the battery. The battery in plug-in hybrids is smaller and has a shorter range than battery-electric cars, so over longer distances, the car starts running on gasoline once the battery has run out. Since plug-in hybrids will often run on petrol, they tend to emit more carbon than battery-electric cars. However, they do usually have lower emissions than petrol or diesel cars. 3 In the first chart below you can see electric car sales broken down by these two technologies. This is given as a share of new cars sold each year. In the second, you will find the share of new electric cars sold that are fully battery-electric . How many new electric cars are sold each year? The chart below shows the total number of new electric cars sold. Again, this includes fully battery-electric and plug-in hybrids . Clicking on any country will show how sales have changed over time. How many new internal combustion engine cars and electric cars are sold each year? Based on the data published by the IEA on the number of electric cars sold, and EV sales as a share of all new cars, we can calculate the absolute number of new cars of each type sold each year. These figures suggest that global sales of non-electric cars peaked in 2018. This aligns with other estimates published elsewhere; for example, Bloomberg New Energy Finance reported that sales peaked in 2017. You can explore this data for other countries in the chart below, too. Stocks of cars in use What share of cars on the road are electric? The cars that are on the road today represent sales data over more than a decade. This can be captured in a metric called stocks. Its an approximation of the number of cars that are in use and represents the balance of cars being added and those that are being retired. Because people use their cars for a long time, it takes time before new sales have a visible influence on car stocks. Besides, advancements in battery technology are significantly enhancing the range, performance, and affordability of EVs. Innovations such as solid-state batteries and improvements in lithium-ion batteries are reducing costs and increasing energy density, making EVs more appealing to consumers. nodes.description: Gather data on current electric vehicle market trends from various online sources.
nodes.agent_prompt: Retrieve comprehensive data on current electric vehicle market trends, including sales figures, market share, growth rates, and regional variations. Focus on reports from reputable market research firms, news articles from reliable sources, and publications from industry associations.

ev_market_data.text: [{'url': 'https://ourworldindata.org/electric-car-sales', 'content': 'Tracking global data on electric vehicles - Our World in Data Our World in Data Browse by topic Data Insights Resources About Subscribe Donate Gdoc / Admin Home Energy Tracking global data on electric vehicles Explore data on electric car sales and stocks worldwide. By: Hannah Ritchie First published in February 2024. Last updated in May 2025. Cite this article Reuse our work freely Electric vehicles are an essential solution to decarbonizing transport. Electric cars tend to have a lower carbon footprint than petrol or diesel cars over their lifetimes. While more carbon is emitted in the manufacturing stage, this carbon debt tends to pay off quickly once theyre on the road. 1 The carbon savings are higher in countries with a cleaner electricity mix , and these savings will also increase as countries continue to decarbonize their electricity grids. How quickly are countries moving to electrified transport? Which countries are leading the way? In this article, we look at data from across the world on electric vehicle (EV) sales and the stock on the road. This data comes from the International Energy Agency . It publishes its Global EV Outlook every year. We will update this data every time a new release is published. 2 Sales of new cars What share of new cars are electric? Sales of electric cars started from a low base but are growing quickly in many markets. Globally, over 1-in-5 (22%) of new cars sold were electric in 2024. This share was 92% in Norway, and in China, it was almost 50%. In the chart below, you can explore these trends across the world. Here, electric cars include fully battery-electric vehicles and plug-in hybrids . Fully-electric cars vs. plug-in hybrids Electric cars include battery-electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles. The difference is that fully battery-electric cars do not have an internal combustion engine. In contrast, plug-in hybrids have a rechargeable battery and electric motor, and an internal combustion engine that runs on gasoline. That means a plug-in hybrid could be driven as a standard petrol car if the owner did not charge the battery. The battery in plug-in hybrids is smaller and has a shorter range than battery-electric cars, so over longer distances, the car starts running on gasoline once the battery has run out. Since plug-in hybrids will often run on petrol, they tend to emit more carbon than battery-electric cars. However, they do usually have lower emissions than petrol or diesel cars. 3 In the first chart below you can see electric car sales broken down by these two technologies. This is given as a share of new cars sold each year. In the second, you will find the share of new electric cars sold that are fully battery-electric . How many new electric cars are sold each year? The chart below shows the total number of new electric cars sold. Again, this includes fully battery-electric and plug-in hybrids . Clicking on any country will show how sales have changed over time. How many new internal combustion engine cars and electric cars are sold each year? Based on the data published by the IEA on the number of electric cars sold, and EV sales as a share of all new cars, we can calculate the absolute number of new cars of each type sold each year. These figures suggest that global sales of non-electric cars peaked in 2018. This aligns with other estimates published elsewhere; for example, Bloomberg New Energy Finance reported that sales peaked in 2017. You can explore this data for other countries in the chart below, too. Stocks of cars in use What share of cars on the road are electric? The cars that are on the road today represent sales data over more than a decade. This can be captured in a metric called stocks. Its an approximation of the number of cars that are in use and represents the balance of cars being added and those that are being retired. Because people use their cars for a long time, it takes time before new sales have a visible influence on car stocks. Key Market Trends & Insights The North America electric vehicle market is expected to grow at a moderate CAGR during the forecast period. Besides, advancements in battery technology are significantly enhancing the range, performance, and affordability of EVs. Innovations such as solid-state batteries and improvements in lithium-ion batteries are reducing costs and increasing energy density, making EVs more appealing to consumers. nodes.description: Research consumer preferences and adoption patterns related to electric vehicles.
nodes.agent_prompt: Investigate consumer preferences regarding electric vehicles, including factors influencing purchase decisions such as range, price, charging infrastructure, and environmental concerns. Analyze consumer surveys, feedback from EV owners, and reports on adoption rates in different demographics.

nodes.description: Investigate technological advancements in electric vehicle technology, including battery technology, charging infrastructure, and autonomous driving features.
nodes.agent_prompt: Gather information on the latest technological advancements in electric vehicle technology. Focus on improvements in battery energy density, charging speeds, the development of charging infrastructure, and the integration of autonomous driving features. Consult technical journals, industry publications, and reports from research institutions.

nodes.description: Analyze government policies and incentives affecting the electric vehicle market, including subsidies, tax credits, and emission regulations.
nodes.agent_prompt: Research government policies and incentives designed to promote the adoption of electric vehicles. Analyze the impact of subsidies, tax credits, emission regulations, and other policy measures on the EV market. Gather information from government websites, policy reports, and legal databases.

nodes.description: Synthesize and analyze the data collected from T001, T002, T003, and T004 to identify key trends and insights in the electric vehicle market.
nodes.agent_prompt: Synthesize the data collected on market trends, consumer preferences, technological advancements, and government policies to identify key trends and insights in the electric vehicle market. Analyze the relationships between these factors and their impact on the overall market dynamics. Identify emerging opportunities and potential challenges for EV manufacturers and stakeholders.

nodes.description: Create a detailed analysis report summarizing the findings from T005, including an executive summary, market overview, trend analysis, and future outlook.
nodes.agent_prompt: Based on the synthesized data and insights from T005, create a detailed analysis report on the electric vehicle market. The report should include an executive summary, a market overview, an in-depth trend analysis, and a future outlook. Ensure the report is well-structured, clearly written, and visually appealing, with appropriate headings, subheadings, and formatting. Pass data from T005.

nodes.description: Create visualizations of sales data and market share trends for the EV market, for inclusion in T006.
nodes.agent_prompt: Generate Python code using Matplotlib and Seaborn to create visualizations of sales data and market share trends for the EV market. Create line charts showing sales growth over time, bar charts comparing market share of different EV manufacturers, and pie charts illustrating regional variations in EV adoption. Ensure the visualizations are clear, informative, and visually appealing. Save the visualizations as PNG image files, named sales_trends.png, market_share.png and regional_adoption.png. The data to be used for this visualization will be available in the data provided from T005. Placeholder in report where these visualization needs to go, so next CoderAgent can update the report.

nodes.description: Create visualizations of technological advancements in EV technology, for inclusion in T006.
nodes.agent_prompt: Generate Python code using Matplotlib and Seaborn to create visualizations of technological advancements in EV technology. Create scatter plots showing the relationship between battery energy density and charging speeds, bar charts comparing the range of different EV models, and heatmaps illustrating the adoption of autonomous driving features. Ensure the visualizations are clear, informative, and visually appealing. Save the visualizations as PNG image files, named battery_tech.png, ev_range.png and autonomous_features.png. The data to be used for this visualization will be available in the data provided from T005. Placeholder in report where these visualization needs to go, so next CoderAgent can update the report.

nodes.description: Integrate the visualizations from T007 and T008 into the analysis report created in T006 and finalize the report.
nodes.agent_prompt: Integrate the visualizations generated in T007 and T008 into the analysis report created in T006. Insert the visualizations at appropriate locations within the report, ensuring they are properly labeled and captioned. Finalize the report by adding a conclusion and recommendations. Pass all the data from T006 and tell FormatterAgent to include the visualization images created in T007 and T008.
